(of a government or organization) to demand an amount of money, such as a tax, from a person or organization: A new tax was levied on consumers of luxury goods. The City Council can levy a fine of $250 for a first offence.
More examplesFewer examplesThe proposal would allow the school to levy additional fees.US citizens are charged $20 on arrival, in retaliation for a similar charge levied for US visa applications.The system would levy significant penalties on hospitals that don't report medical errors.
